result.execSummary:
The defendant Lornell Washington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all supervision fees; pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments and costs. The Court ordered restitution set at zero. The Court ordered that all financial obligations be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program AFTER SERVING 2 1/2 YEARS OF THESE SENTENCES
Concurrent with: with Count 2, CONSECUTIVE to any other time being served with credit for 0 days served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain GED or HSED.
Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time school and part time employment.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

No drug dealing or association with drug community (drug users/dealers or drug houses).
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with victim M.H. (d.o.b. 8-3-2001).

Obtain Mental Health assessment and if necessary successfully complete follow-up treatment. 
Take prescription medication only in the manner/dosage as prescribed by a treating physician.
Cooperate with random urine screens.
Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Provide DNA sample--pay surcharge.
Obtain AODA assessment and successfully complete follow-up treatment.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with Count 1, CONSECUTIVE to any other time being served with credit for 0 days served

superMiscConds.notes: See Count 1 for Extended Supervision conditions

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lornell Washington

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING (58 pages) commencing OCTOBER 6, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Lornell Washington in court with attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  Defendant Lornell Washington in custody.  Margaret Anne Kunisch for Megan Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to both counts:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Attorney Anne M. Jaspers in court, defendant Lornell Washington not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Due to time constraints on today (calendar congestion) new date selected with the parties.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
At the request of defense Plea and Sentencing set for 8-25-14 at 1:30 p.m. RESCHEDULED to 8:30 a.m.  before Branch 21.

Attorney Anne M. Jaspers in court, defendant Lornell Washington not in court, in custody in Racine.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

submitted by the defendant, filed.
*defendant represented*

Attorney Anne M Jaspers in court, defendant Lornell Washington not in court, in custody(Dodge Correctional).  Megan P Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held.  Defense awaiting discovery from the state.  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Anne M Jaspers in court, defendant Lornell Washington not in court, in custody at Dodge Correctional Institution.  Megan P Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.   The state needs additional time to provide discovery to defense.  Status conference scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Anne M Jaspers in court, defendant Lornell Washington not in court, in custody (Dodge correctional  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.).  Megan P Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING  (15 pages) commencing APRIL 14, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Lornell Washington in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Lornell Washington in custody.  Jesica Ballenger for Megan P Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Michael Wawrzyniakowski-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lornell Washington in court with attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  Defendant Lornell Washington in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
